com.viaoa.object

Class OAHierFinder<F extends OAObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.object.OAHierFinder<F>

  • public class OAHierFinder<F extends OAObject>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is used to find the first value in an object hierarchy (including recursive) that has a matching value in the first object, or one of the objects in it's hierarchy, as defined by propertyPaths. example: Employee.department.location.region.country; where location is recursive (has parent locations) and each object in the hierarchy has a property to know if it has "specialFlag" or not. OAHierFinder f = new OAHierFinder(EmployeePP.specialFlag, EmployeePP.location().region().country()) f.findFirstValue(employee, filter);
